newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-PROFILE OF WORLD WOMEN'S 800 METRES CHAMPION QUIROT.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-PROFILE OF WORLD WOMEN'S 800 METRES CHAMPION QUIROT.

text.p: Profile of Ana Fidelia Quirot, who won the world women's 800 metres title on Saturday.
Won a record 39 consecutive 800 finals from 1987 until 1990.
Took bronze in the 1991 world championships and the 1992 Olympics.
Sustained severe burns in a domestic accident in January 1993. While fighting for her life in hospital, she gave birth prematurely to a daughter, who died after a week.
Was back at her best in 1995, winning the world title. Took silver at last year's Olympics in Atlanta.
